content:
It sounds like you're being proactive about protecting your boots and taking steps to prevent future losses at the gym.

Remember to ask the gym about their policy on storing lost items, and don't hesitate to ask any follow-up questions if you're not clear on their procedures. It's always better to be informed and prepared.

Regarding your boots, getting a waterproofing spray or cream is a great idea! It'll help protect the leather from water and stains, and keep them looking their best. You can also consider conditioning the leather regularly to keep it soft and supple.

If you do decide to get a waterproofing spray or cream, make sure to read the instructions carefully and follow the recommended application process. You might also want to test a small, inconspicuous area of the boot first to make sure the product doesn't affect the color or texture of the leather.

By taking care of your boots and being mindful of your belongings at the gym, you'll be able to enjoy your activities without worrying about your gear. Happy trails, and I hope you get your shoes back soon!
